Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • Renderable
      • ImageBox
        • OnGrid
          • Entity
            • Moving
              • Enemy
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DumbTargetEnemy, SmartTargetEnemy, StraightLineEnemy, WallFollowEnemy

    public abstract class Enemy
extends Moving
    An moving entity that calculates its own next move.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Adam Jennings 955770

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy(int x,
             int y,
             Map map,
             Direction startingDirection)
        Creates an enemy at a given location and facing a given direction for a map. Doesn't add the enemy to the map!
        Parameters:
        x - The starting x coordinate for this enemy on the map.
        y - The starting y coordinate for this enemy on the map.
        map - The map this enemy is for.
        startingDirection - The direction this enemy starts facing.

    • Method Detail

        public void preformNextMove()
        Gets the next move and moves in that direction.

      • checkForUnWalkable

        public boolean checkForUnWalkable(Direction checkDirection)
        Checks if there's an unwalkable(wall) in a direction
        Parameters:
        checkDirection - The direction to check
        Returns:
        True if there is an unwalkable(Wall), false otherwise.

      • canWalkOn

        public boolean canWalkOn(OnGrid gridObject)
        Description copied from class: Moving
        Checks if this is allowed to walk on an object on the grid.
        Overrides:
        canWalkOn in class Moving
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • stepOn

        public void stepOn(Moving steppedOnBy,
                   Direction fromDir)
        Description copied from class: OnGrid
        Steps on this object to cause a reaction. The default behaviour is to do nothing in reaction.
        Overrides:
        stepOn in class OnGrid
        Parameters:
        steppedOnBy - The moving object that stepped on this object.
        fromDir - The direction the moving object moved to step on this.
